info.title: Concussion Recovery App ‚Äì GPT Tools
info.description: Tools for triage, symptom tracking, stage guidance, and export in a concussion recovery GPT.

x-gpt-action.name: Fetch Full Triage Flow
x-gpt-action.instructions:
Use this at the start of triage to load the full question map. Walk the user through questions one at a time using `prompt`, track the `id`, and apply the `mode` (e.g., probe, clarify).

Key behavior:
- Track each answer in an `answers` map like `{ id: answer }`
- After final question, call `/log_incident_detail` with all answers
- If a `skip_if` is present (e.g., `seen_provider=false`), GPT should:
  1. Skip asking the question
  2. Infer the answer (e.g., `diagnosed_concussion=false`)
  3. Confirm with the user: ‚ÄúI‚Äôll mark ‚Äòdiagnosed_concussion‚Äô as false ‚Äî is that okay?‚Äù

üîç If the intent is `symptoms`:
- Use `symptom_links` to match input to known symptoms
- Ask for severity (1‚Äì10)
- Format as: `{ symptom_id: score }`

200.description: Returns all questions in triage map

prompt.example: Who are you reporting this for?

mode.description: Use 'probe' to follow up, 'clarify' to confirm answer if responses lack detail or are unclear

skip_if.description: If the condition is met, GPT should skip this question and infer the answer.

x-gpt-action.name: Log Incident Details
x-gpt-action.instructions:
Call this after completing triage. Format payload as:
- `user_id`: string
- `timestamp`: ISO date string
- `answers`: a dictionary mapping question IDs to answers

If including `symptoms`, pass them as a **dictionary**: `{ "headache": 7, "dizziness": 2 }`.
Avoid sending it as a list.
Scores should range from 1 (mild) to 10 (severe). If score is unclear, use 1 as default.

answers.description: Key-value map of triage answers. Use string, boolean, or list of strings. For `symptoms`, provide a dictionary of { symptom_id: score }.

injury_context.example: He hit his head on the boards

symptoms.description: Dictionary of symptom IDs and their scores (1‚Äì10)

example.injury_context: He got hit from behind and hit his head on the boards

post.summary: Evaluate red flags and symptom severity

x-gpt-action.name: Assess Concussion Risk
x-gpt-action.instructions:
Use this after symptoms have been logged to check for red flags or high-risk patterns. Submit only the `user_id`.

If:
- `concussion_likely = true`, emphasize monitoring and urge clinical evaluation.
- `red_flags` are present, gently but clearly recommend urgent medical attention.
- Only `moderate_risk_symptoms` exist, advise rest and monitoring, and suggest seeing a provider if symptoms persist or worsen.

Example phrases:
- ‚ÄúSome symptoms raise concern. It‚Äôs best to check with a healthcare provider.‚Äù
- ‚ÄúThis pattern suggests a possible concussion. Please rest and monitor closely.‚Äù
- ‚ÄúRed flags were detected ‚Äî please seek clinical help immediately.‚Äù

user_id.description: User ID to assess symptom log for

200.description: Returns red flag and risk-level symptom findings, plus an assessment summary and recommendation text.

concussion_likely.description: True if red flags, high risk symptoms, or 3+ moderate symptoms were found

red_flags.description: Red flag symptoms ‚Äî these require urgent attention

high_risk_symptoms.description: High-risk symptoms ‚Äî clinical check is advised

moderate_risk_symptoms.description: Moderate symptoms ‚Äî monitor and seek help if they persist

summary.description: Human-readable assessment summary for the user

x-gpt-action.name: Log Symptoms
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to log new or updated symptoms after triage. Ask the user to rate each symptom from 1 (very mild) to 10 (very severe). Match to a known symptom definition when possible using `symptom_input`. If there‚Äôs no match, store it with category `other`. Include optional notes if the user adds context (e.g., time of day, triggers).

symptoms.description: List of symptoms reported by the user

score.description: Severity score from 1 (mild) to 10 (severe). GPT should ask the user how much this symptom is affecting them on that scale.

notes.example: mostly in the morning or after reading

x-gpt-action.name: Get Stage Guidance
x-gpt-action.instructions:
Use this after a symptom check-in to determine the user's current recovery stage.

Required:
- `user_id`: unique ID used in prior logs

Optional:
- `symptoms`: dictionary of { symptom_id: score }, if triage not done
- `injury_date`: ISO date string if not previously logged
- `checkin_time`: timestamp for when this check-in occurred (default is now)

If `symptoms` and `injury_date` are not included, the system will fetch recent symptom logs. If missing, notify the user to complete a triage check-in.

üß† How to communicate results:
- Provide a brief, clear explanation of the user's current recovery stage (e.g., 'You‚Äôre currently in Stage 2 ‚Äì Light Activity').
- Be empathetic and reassuring: 'Everyone heals at a different pace. Let‚Äôs make sure we‚Äôre tracking things properly.'
- Offer return-to-play guidance: explain what is and isn‚Äôt safe right now, based on the stage.
- Be prepared to answer user questions, like whether they can return to practice or competition.
- Always remind them: 'I'm not a doctor, but I can help guide you through the structured recovery steps.'

user_id.description: User ID used in previous logs

injury_date.description: Injury date if triage not done

symptoms.description: Dictionary of symptoms and severity if check-in not done

checkin_time.description: Timestamp of check-in, defaults to now

stage_summary.example: You may resume light activity, but no contact sports yet. Monitor symptoms closely.

post.summary: Export summary as PDF and FHIR bundle

x-gpt-action.name: Export Summary
x-gpt-action.instructions:
Call this to generate a follow-up care summary for a user. You must pass the `user_id` used in prior triage or symptom logs.

This action will return:
- `pdf_url`: A downloadable PDF file with triage, symptom, and stage information
- `fhir_bundle`: A structured medical handoff in FHIR format

üß† How to communicate results:
- Tell the user: 'Here‚Äôs a summary of what we‚Äôve logged together.'
- If they‚Äôre a parent or coach, say: 'You can share this PDF with your doctor, school, or coach.'
- If they ask what FHIR is, explain: 'It‚Äôs a standard format for medical data. Some clinics may be able to import it directly.'
- Reassure: 'This isn‚Äôt a diagnosis, but a summary of what‚Äôs been recorded and assessed so far.'

200.description: Returns PDF URL and FHIR bundle

pdf_url.description: Signed Azure Blob URL to download summary PDF

fhir_bundle.description: FHIR-compliant JSON bundle of symptom, triage, and stage data

parameters.description: The user ID to fetch symptom logs for

x-gpt-action.name: View Logged Symptoms
x-gpt-action.instructions:
Use this to show a user their past symptom check-ins.

Returns a list of all symptoms recorded for the given user_id, including:
- `symptom_id`: canonical symptom name
- `score`: 1‚Äì10 severity score
- `notes`: optional metadata or freeform notes
- `timestamp`: when the symptom was logged

üß† How to communicate results:
- 'Here are the symptom check-ins you‚Äôve recorded.'
- Explain trends: 'Looks like headache severity dropped from 6 to 2 over the last week.'
- Offer next steps: 'Want to do another check-in now?'
- Reassure: 'This is just for tracking ‚Äî it‚Äôs not a clinical diagnosis.'

200.description: List of logged symptoms with scores and timestamps

notes.example: User noted mild throbbing after school.
